data.title: Faculty & Staff — North Jakarta International School
data.text:
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Human Kinetics (BEd) - University of British Columbia - 1994

Bachelor’s of Education (BEd) - University of British Columbia - 1996

Master’s of Education (MEd) - Western Washington University - 2003

Washington Principal Licensure (Equivalent) - Washington State University - 2014

Experience:

Riverdale Elementary - Teacher and Athletics and Technology Director: 1998 - 2003

American School Foundation of Monterrey - Teacher and Student Advisory Coordinator: 2003 - 2007

Singapore American School - Teacher, Curriculum Head and Team Leader: 2007 - 2014

North Jakarta Intercultural School - Teacher and PYP Coordinator: 2019 - 2024​

Hailing from beautiful Vancouver, Canada, Ezra is excited to put his knowledge and passion for learning to the test as the 4th-grade teacher and PYP Coordinator at North Jakarta Intercultural School. Graduating from the University of British Columbia with a B.Ed, he worked several years with inner-city children in Surrey, B.C. During that time, Ezra returned to school and graduated with an M.Ed in School Leadership from Western Washington University.

With extended teaching stays at the American Foundation School of Monterrey, Mexico and Singapore American School, Ezra is happy to now call Indonesia his home. Outside of work, you can find him spending quality time with his family, losing golf balls on one of Jakarta’s many scenic courses or zipping up and down the ice during an ice hockey game at Bintaro Xchange Mall.

Qualifications:

Bachelor of Education and Training - University of Kwa-Zulu Natal - 2013

Experience:

Educator - Durban Academy - 2010 – 2015

Subject Teaching Experience - Durban Academy - 2011 – 2016

Head Of Grade (Acting) - Durban Academy - 2014 – 2015

English HL/FAL Tutor 2003 – 2005 - Kip McGrath Education Centers - 2015 – 2016

Mr. Warren Wessels introduces himself as a South African educator hailing from Durban, a popular destination known as "South Africa's playground." He holds a Bachelor of Education degree in Further Education and Training from the University of Kwa-Zulu Natal. Mr. Wessels specializes in Biological Sciences and English Language and Literature, recognizing the importance of biology in understanding life and the significance of English in navigating it. Drawing inspiration from Indonesian author Pramoedya Ananta Toer, he embraces the idea that painting is literature expressed through colors, while literature is akin to painting using language.

Mr. Wessels embarked on his teaching career in 2010, initially instructing Senior Biology and English at his alma mater, Durban Academy. After six and a half years, he decided to explore new opportunities and found his way to NJIS, where he currently teaches. Beyond the classroom, Mr. Wessels derives his passion for life from nature, acknowledging the incredible beauty of our planet. With a camera in hand, he aims to capture the captivating wonders, diverse cultures, and remarkable individuals that inhabit our world. He abides by the personal motto inspired by philosopher Rumi, encouraging himself and others to venture beyond comfort, embrace notoriety, and seek out those who ignite their passions.

Watch this video introduction from Mr. Warren

Qualifications:

Master Degree in Business Management-M. M, - Universitas Indonesia – 2009

Bachelor Degree in Physics Education-S.Pd - Universitas Sriwijaya – 2000

Indonesian Principal Certification, Ministry of Education and Culture - 2018

Experience:

SMA Kusuma Bangsa Palembang - Physics Teacher - 2000 - 2003

Putera Sampoerna Foundation - School Development Officer - 2007 - 2010

Sekolah Victory Plus IB World School - Secondary School Principal - 2010 – 2021

Hendriadi has been working in the education field for more than two decades. He started his career as high school Physics teacher in an Indonesian national school before moving to an IB school as a PYP teacher and later as a high school Mathematics, Geography and Economics teacher. In 2007, he received a scholarship from Putera Sampoerna Foundation to pursue his master’s degree in Business Management and continued working with them to establish international standards schools across the country for students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds.

Hendriadi has always been passionate about learning and currently is pursuing another master degree in advanced teaching from University of the People, USA. Other than that, he likes to exercise, make healthy breads and occasionally travel around the country and abroad.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Education - University of Windsor – 2008

Master’s of Educational Administration - University of Windsor – 2009

Experience:

Teaching Assistant - Faculty of Education University of Windsor – 2006 – 2008

Teacher Accounting/Economics Grade 10-12. 2004 - 2006

Teacher Humanities grade 7-9 - Binus International School – 2004 – 2006

Elementary School Teacher - Ottawa-Carleton District School Board, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada - 2009 – 2016

Esi is a Canadian certified teacher qualified to teach Kindergarten-Grade 6. She has experience teaching in both Indonesia and Canada since 2004. She received her teaching credentials, Bachelor of Education (B.Ed.) and Masters of Education (M.Ed.) from the University of Windsor, Ontario, Canada.

Growing up, Esi had the experience of attending school in Birmingham, England, starting when she was in Grade 3. Later, she met her life partner (Mr. Dan, the PYP 5 teacher) in Vancouver Island, Canada, in 2001, when both were involved in community service helping first nations

Aside from being a teacher, she developed her entrepreneurship skills while on maternity leave in Canada. With her child's diet and allergy needs, combined with her interest in baking, she opened a vegan and gluten-free cupcake store. Her other passions include facilitating dance education activities for Kindergarten to grade 6. For example, her two favourite workshops are teaching the fast-paced “Kecak” dance from Bali and the smooth “Saman” dance from Aceh. She loves helping boys and girls build confidence physically, socially, and creatively.”

Qualifications:

Ji Nan Da Xue Language School - China - 2001

Bachelor of Mandarin Literature – Darma Persada - 2003

Experience:

Mandarin Part-Time Teacher for Kindergarten – Bunda Hati Kudus School

Mandarin Teacher for KG - Highschool at Hati Suci School

Mandarin Teacher for Primary 1-3 - Bukit Sion School

Mandarin Teacher for Lower Kindergarten - Tutor Time School

Mandarin Teacher for lower and Primary 1 - Global Sevilla

Lao Shi Mimi is a passionate and dedicated teacher who believes in the power of education. With her vibrant personality, she creates an engaging classroom environment where students thrive academically and personally. Lao Shi Mimi is committed to continuous learning and constantly seeks innovative teaching methods to bring fresh ideas to her lessons. She not only focuses on Mandarin communication skills but also places importance on developing strong writing abilities. With her warm and approachable nature, Lao Shi Mimi is not just a teacher but also a trustworthy mentor who cares about the overall growth and well-being of her students.

Join her classroom for an exciting learning adventure where every student is empowered to reach their full potential.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Financial Mangement - Indonesia Institute of Business and Informatics - 2005

Master’s of Education, Teaching Chinese to Speakers of Other Languages - Hunan Normal University China - 2022

Experience:

Supervisor and MandarinTeacher – Aixin Mandarin Course 2001 – 2010

Mandarin Teacher – Santo Yacobus School Kelapa Gading 2019 – 2022

Mandarin Private Teacher for Primary – Senior High School 2011 – present

Meet Rita Jap: a passionate educator with a diverse cultural background. Native in Mandarin, she began as a Mandarin assistant teacher and rose to become a coordinator and assistant principal. Even after becoming a mother, she continued teaching privately. In 2019, she earned a Master's in Education, specializing in Teaching Chinese to Speakers of Other Languages. Rita's warm, enthusiastic approach fosters curiosity, creativity, and appreciation for cultural diversity in her students, preparing them for success in our interconnected world. Beyond teaching, she enjoys cooking, gardening, and embracing life to the fullest. Rita's lifelong dedication to education shapes a thrilling journey of language and culture for her students.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of English for Education - Atmajaya Catholic University - 2011

Experience:

Mighty Minds Preschool - Co-Teaching - 2016 – 2018

Mighty Minds Preschool - Lead Teacher - 2018 – 2019

Westy Irene Wohon is originally from Jakarta, and she goes by Westy for short. She was born and raised in Jakarta and took English for Education, which specifies Early Childhood Education, at Atmajaya Catholic University in Jakarta. She has taught children from age 5 to 2; younger children will always have a special place in her heart. She has taught for five years before she is now working at NJIS, and this will be her fourth year teaching at NJIS. The early Years are a golden year in a child's life, so it is essential to have a strong foundation. Westy strongly believes that learning should be fun and engaging, so creating a fun environment will build a strong learning foundation.

Qualifications:

Bachelor of Psychology – Atma Jaya Catholic University of Indonesia - 2010

Master of Educational Technology – Pelita Harapan University – 2020

Experience:

Primary Teacher Assistant – Sinarmas World Academy – 2016-2017

K2 Homeroom Teacher – Apple Tree Preschool BSD – 2017-2019

Co Teacher – Sampoerna Academy BSD – 2019-2022

Christella Meirissa is an Indonesian and a new member at NJIS. She graduated from Atma Jaya Catholic University of Indonesia majoring in Psychology. Then, she took her master at Pelita Harapan University focusing on Early Childhood Education. Prior completion of her master study, she has been dedicating her knowledge and skills to teach and guide young children.

She is interested and loves to work in the early childhood education field because she has a natural passion for helping and encouraging young children to reach their potentials, she enjoys transferring essential knowledge, values, and skills. Additionally, she wants to be a part of a child’s development and watch them grow strong in their social and emotional well-being.

Qualifications:

Diploma of Montessori Teaching - 2021

Broadcasting - Universitas Bunda Mulia - 2020

Bachelor’s of Early Childhood Education - Universitas Terbuka - 2014

Experience:

ELF - Teacher - 2015 – 2016

Tutor Time – Teacher - 2016 – 2018

Private – Shadow Teacher - 2018 – 2019

NJIS - Teaching Assistant - 2020-2021

Christania Anthonny or Tania was originally from Indonesia. She started to work in the Early Childhood Education field from the year 2014 and fell in love with it eversince. She admires the work of Dr. Montessori for the early years and that is what inspires me to become a better educator from time to time. To see the life of children growing and developing in their golden period is her biggest passion.

In her point of view, what makes the EY different is that we focus not only on their academic skill but we also prepare them for life, not only for school. She believes every child is unique in their own ways – just like beautiful flowers in the middle of a garden, they make this world a wonderful place to live.

Qualifications:

Englsh Literature - Gadjah Mada University - 2016

Experience:

Senior Teacher Pedagogy – Ruangguru (Alta School) – 2021 - 2023

Lead Teacher – Apple Tree Preschool – 2017 - 2021

Teacher – Hansol Kids Preschool – 2016 – 2017

Ms. Amanda Vanyakila, also known as Ms. Vanya to her students, is a lifelong learner and a dedicated teacher by profession. She holds a Bachelor of Science degree majoring in English Literature from Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM). With seven years of experience, she has been teaching at the preschool, kindergarten, and elementary levels.

According to Ms. Vanya, being flexible, creative, fun, and patient are all vital qualities that contribute to being a great teacher. However, she believes that the most crucial aspect is the passion and love for the calling to teach, which makes it "a work of the heart." Her artistic talents shine through the way she creates teaching materials, and her love for reading is evident in her creative storytelling.

Ms. Vanya is eagerly looking forward to working with the children, viewing it as both a responsibility and a privilege.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of English for Education – Satya Wacana Christian University - 2004

Master’s of Educational Technology – Pelita Harapan University - 2021

Indonesian Principal Certification, Ministry of Education and Culture - 2021

Bachelor’s of Early Childhood Education – Indonesia Open University - 2023

Experience:

Nursery Form Teacher – Apple Kids Preschool Salatiga - 2004

3-8 years old Class Teacher, Coordinator – Fastrackids / Hope for Kids PIK - 2005 – 2007

N2-K2 Form Teacher, Coordinator, Administrative Head Teacher – SIS PIK - 2007 – 2023

Meliana, born and raised in Salatiga, has always had a deep passion for early childhood education. Her experience in various leadership roles and interactions with parents from diverse backgrounds have honed her communication skills, which she believes are vital in helping children reach their full potential. Guiding and teaching young minds brings her immense joy, especially when she sees their faces light up as they explore and learn. In her free time, she enjoys being with her family, watching movies, going to the gym, playing Royal Match, and traveling to admire nature's beauty. As an educator, she strives to be an encouraging, joyful, present, and wise leader for her students. She looks forward to creating unforgettable memories and supporting her students in becoming global citizens and lifelong learners.

Qualifications

Teaching/Licenciate Degree in Portuguese and Spanish and their respective literatures - Fundação Universidade do Tocantins, Brazil, 2010

TESOL - Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages, CTC Vancouver, Canada, 2010

PGCEi - University of Nottingham, UK, 2022

Experience

ESL Teacher, CCAA Language School, Castro, Brazil, Feb 2011 - Dec 2013

Subject Language Teacher - Portuguese Grammar and Literature for upper primary and ESL Teacher for Kindergarten and primary. SEPAM Bilingual School, Castro, Brazil, Mar 2012 - Dec 2013

ESL Teacher - CNA Language School, Sinop, Brazil, Mar 2014 - May 2017

ESL Teacher, Colégio CAD Bilingual School, Sinop, Brazil, Feb 2015 - July 2017

Kindergarten Homeroom Teacher - SISB, Bangkok, Thailand, Aug 2017 - July 2022

Ms. Elizabeth is an international kindergarten teacher born in the countryside of Brazil. As such, she takes pleasure in bringing joy, light, and smiles to her practice.

She guides young learners to develop essential skills that are of pivotal importance to their lives. She also teaches them how to read and write their first sentences. Most importantly, she teaches them the meaning of things, not only how to decode words and phrases. She trains EAL learners on how to communicate effectively to explain their understanding of the world which gives her a clearer idea of how to support her students in their needs without hurting their confidence.

She likes to practice sports, enjoy the outside, and travel in her free time.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's of Education - BS - Wisconsin Lutheran College - 2018

Experience:

Mt. Lebanon Lutheran School - 4th Grade Educational Assistant, 2018 - 2021

Irene Magdalena, a Kelapa Gading native, has recently returned home to Indonesia to continue inspiring bright minds to learn and develop. Prior to this, Irene spent 7 years in the United States, where she studied Elementary Education and Psychology in Wisconsin Lutheran College. She also taught in the Milwaukee Public School system for about 2 years.

Outside of teaching, you can find Irene learning new languages or trying out different dishes from other countries. She looks forward to meeting the PYP 1 families!

Qualifications:

Faculdade Estácio – BA in Pedagogy, 2012-2016

University of Bristol - M.Ed in Psychology of Education, 2009-2010

Universidade Tuiuti do Paraná - BA in Journalism, 1998-2002

Experience:

Pedagogical Coordinator - International School of Curitiba - Brazil (2023 -2024)

Kindergarten Teacher - International School of Curitiba - Brazil (2013 - 2023)

Kindergarten Teacher - Everest International School, Curitiba - Brazil (2012)

Keyworker for Reception - Millpond Primary School, Bristol - UK (Sep 2010 - Nov 2011)

Dean of Discipline - Le Châtelard, (Boarding School) Switzerland (Aug 2007 - July 2009)

Kindergarten and 1st grade Teacher -Everest International School - Brazil (2002 - 2007)

Ms. Bianca, a dedicated teacher from Brazil, brings over two decades of experience in education to NJIS. Her love for traveling and learning about different cultures has taken her to Switzerland, England, and the USA.Ms. Bianca prioritizes her students' well-being and fosters a sense of belonging in her classroom. She builds strong teacher-student relationships to enhance learning and encourages curiosity, exploration, and active knowledge construction. The joy she feels when a child grasps a new concept drives her passion for teaching.Recently joining the NJIS family, Ms. Bianca is excited to be part of this community and to explore the beauty of Indonesia with her husband and two daughters, Helena and Beatriz.

Qualifications:

Bachelor of Arts in English - University of Reading - 2008

PGCE - Canterbury Christchurch University - 2010

Experience:

English language assistant - Lycée militaire d'Aix-en-Provence, France 2004-2005

Class Teacher St Martin’s CofE Primary School, Kent - 2010-2024

Holly was born in a quiet rural area in southern England and after studying for her degree, she spent time travelling around the globe with her husband - sparking a lifelong love of travel and culture. Since qualifying as a primary teacher, she has enjoyed many years teaching primary children in an Ofsted rated outstanding school on England’s coastline. During her career she has been a language specialist in school, supported many children with a wide range of special educational needs and has years of experience teaching children across all ages in primary.

Holly wanted to be a teacher from a very young age and sees her role as educator, inspiring young minds as they begin to learn about the world, as a real privilege. Outside of school, Holly loves relaxing on the beach with her family or taking long walks in the sunshine.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Arts: Drama in Education & Community - University of Windsor Ontario - 2008

Bachelor of Education: Generalist Teaching and Drama & Social Science - University of Windsor Ontario - 2008

Bachelor’s of Education : Generalist Teaching and Drama & Social Science - University of Windsor Ontario - 2009

Experience:

ESL Teacher - The British Institute - 2003 – 2004

Supply Teacher for Grade 1-6 Math, English, Visual Art, Gym, Special Education - Chelsea Elementary School & Lord Aylmer School – 2010 - 2014

Specialist Teacher of Grade 3-6 - Lord Aylmer Elementary School - 2014 – 2015

Specialist Teacher of Grade 3-6 Drama & Literacy/Numeracy Resource Teacher, Lord Aylmer Elementary School - 2015 – 2016

Homeroom Teacher of Grade 4/5/6 English, Math, Drama, Music, Early Literacy, Onslow Elementary School - 2016 – 2017

Mr. Dan is a certified teacher from Canada qualified to teach primary grades 4-6 for homeroom subjects and secondary grades 7-12 with specializations in Drama and Social Science. He also has a B.A. Honors in Drama in Education and Community and a minor in Psychology. Mr. Dan combines writing, role-play, and technology to create exciting learning experiences for his students.

This approach connects back to the start of his career, where he wrote and directed public education campaigns for the City of Ottawa, including a series of cartoons teaching citizens how to share the road safely. He fell in love with teaching English, Math, and Drama for five years in the Western Quebec School Board in Canada. Highlights from his time so far at NJIS include co-directing the NJIS stage musical production of Annie Jr., hosting the online NJIS Game Nights, and guiding students to take action on global issues with the annual PYP Exhibition.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Humanities - Program Studi Indonesia, Fakultas Ilmu Pengetahuan Budaya, Universitas Indonesia - 2006

Master of Early Childhood - Institute of Early Childhood, Macquarie University, Australia - 2009

Experience:

Possums’ Corner, Sydney - Childcare Worker - 2009

Tutor Time Corporate Office - Curriculum Specialist - 2009 – 2012

Tutor Time Pondok Indah - Lead Teacher (Preschool to Pre-kindergarten) - 2012 – 2018

Ibu Dea is the name the children use to address her. She teaches PYP Bahasa Indonesia and PPKn/Indonesian Studies. She has been a part of NJIS since 2018 and is incredibly happy to work and collaborate with her colleagues in order to create meaningful and enjoyable learning experiences. She graduated from the Faculty of Humanities at the University of Indonesia in 2006, where she majored in Indonesian linguistics. In 2008, she furthered her learning journey by participating in the Translation and Interpretation Preparation Program (TIPP) at Macquarie University. She obtained a master's degree in Early Childhood from the same university. Ibu Dea looks forward to meeting her students in Bahasa Indonesia class!

Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science (BSc) – University of Stellenbosch – 1998

Higher Education Diploma (HED) – University of Stellenbosch – 2001

Experience:

HEAD OF MATHEMATICAL LITERACY & HEAD OF DESIGN & TECHNOLOGY – Muizenberg High School, South Africa - 2006 – 2007

MATHEMATICS TEACHER ADVISER & MATHEMATICS CURRICULUM SPECIALIST – School Improvement Partnership, UAE - 2008 – 2012

MATHEMATICS TEACHER – Shanghai United International School, China - 2016 – 2017

SENIOR DEAN OF MIDDLE SCHOOL– BASIS International School Shenzhen, China - 2017 – 2022

GRADE HEAD (GRADE 10) & MATHEMATICS TEACHER – Abbotts College, South Africa - 2013 – 2016

MATHEMATICS TEACHER – Parklands College, South Africa – 2022 – 2024

Waldo is a dynamic and visionary leader as well as an educator with 24 years of experience in education, specializing in mathematics. He began his education career in South Africa in 2001. He has worked internationally in the Middle East for four years and China for six years. Waldo has held various leadership roles, including Senior Dean of Middle School, Acting Vice-Head of Middle School, and mathematics and science instructor. His notable achievements include initiating and implementing Academic Support Programs. Most recently, Waldo contributed his expertise at an Apple Distinguished School in Cape Town, South Africa. He taught mathematics to students from 8th to 12th grade, including advanced placement (AP) Mathematics courses. Waldo is known for his exceptional communication skills, making complex mathematical concepts accessible to his students. His unwavering dedication to academic excellence and student well-being positions him as an innovative and influential educational leader. When he is not at school he spends time with his family, coaching his son tennis and a proud supporter of all his son’s sporting codes (swimming, cricket and field hockey).

Qualifications:

Completed Rhythmic Movement Training International (RMTi) and the Making Movement course - 2024

Professional Master Degree of Educational Psychology - Universitas Padjadjaran - 2017

Bachelor’s of Psychology - Universitas Padjadjaran – 2014

Experience:

Singapore School PIK - Emotional & Well-Being Counselor - 2023 to 2024

Faculty of Psychology Universitas Padjadjaran - Honorarium Lecturer For Professional Master Degree Students - 2022 to 2023

Sekolah Victory Plus Bekasi - Whole School Inclusion Coordinator - 2020 to 2022

Sekolah Victory Plus Bekasi - PYP School Counselor - 2017 to 2022

Ms. Arlita is a dedicated school counselor with seven years of experience in supporting students' academic and personal growth. She believes that every individual continuously learns new things throughout their life, making it essential to foster students' well-being and personal development. Ms. Arlita aims to create a safe and inclusive environment where all students feel valued and collaborate closely with teachers, parents, and the community to promote student success.

In her spare time, Ms. Arlita enjoys reading books and journals, as well as listening to music, watching movies, and dancing to stay youthful and relatable to her predominantly student clients. She also actively participates in professional development activities to enrich her counseling approach. Ultimately, Ms. Arlita strives to empower her students and help them thrive both academically and personally.

Qualifications:

Master of Education in TESOL – University of Wollongong – 2009

Graduate Diploma in TESOL – University of Wollongong – 2008

Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering – Tarumanagara University – 2006

Experience:

Bilingual Program Coordinator at Santa Aurelia Kindergarten and Primary School: 2018 – 2023

English Tutor at The English Resource Centre: 2010 – 2020

Born and bred in Jakarta, Roy is not only familiar with teaching Indonesian students, but he also has experience in assisting students with diverse cultural backgrounds. During his time studying in Australia, he taught students from Korea, Japan, China, Vietnam, Libya, and Saudi Arabia in both formal and informal settings. Roy firmly believes in creating a fun and exciting environment for students to learn and enjoy their time at school. A happy father of three, with a daughter and twin boys, Roy has a keen interest in books (especially as an avid Harry Potter fan), movies (except horror), jogging, and savoring good food (with pizza as his favorite). During weekends, he loves spending time with his family and friends and takes pleasure in cleaning the house. Roy draws inspiration from Paulo Coelho's "The Alchemist" with his favorite quote, "The darkest hour of the night came just before the dawn," which has been his guiding light in both his professional and personal life, propelling him forward with unwavering determination.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree from Metropolitan State College of Denver in Political Science and History

Colorado Teachers License in Math and K-6 Education

Experience:

Cherry Creek and Denver Public Schools - middle school math, science and classroom teacher - 2010-2016

Abu Dhabi Education Council - math teacher - 2016-2024

Michael hails from Denver, Colorado, and brings a wealth of experience to NJIS with 15 years in the teaching field. Before joining NJIS, Michael spent 6 years teaching in Denver and another 8 years in Abu Dhabi. He finds the most joy in teaching when students have those "ah-ha" moments and realize they truly understand a concept.

Outside the classroom, Michael is an avid adventurer and enjoys a variety of activities. He loves scuba diving, snowboarding, and playing ice hockey. Michael is also passionate about golf and enjoys cooking delicious meals with his wife. His diverse interests and rich teaching background make him a valuable addition to the NJIS community.

Qualifications:

Bachelor of Education (English and Korean) – East-Kazakhstan State University – 2012

Educational Certificate in Secondary school education, School and Society – University of Boras, Sweden – 2012

Bachelor of Economics, Turan University, Kazakhstan – 2014

Experience:

Miras International school Astana, Kazakhstan – MYP/DP English teacher; Head of English Department, Deputy MYP Coordinator – 2012-2018

Haileybury International school, Beijing, China – middle school English teacher – 2018-2019

Ulink College Guangzhou, China – High school English teacher – 2019-2022

International school of London, Doha, Qatar – MYP/DP English teacher – 2022-2024

Diana has been working in the education field for 12 years. Over the time she has grown professionally and personally. Throughout her career she took opportunities in leadership positions and enjoyed both inspiring her colleagues and students. Diana is also an experienced visiting team member of the Council of International schools (CIS) accreditation organization. She has been a part of accreditation teams in schools in China, Ukraine, Korea, UAE, Lebanon and others.

Diana is passionate about tennis and traveling. She always uses an opportunity to travel to a new place and explore a new culture, which makes teaching internationally more purposeful and fun. At the moment Diana is pursuing her Master’s degree in Educational Management and Leadership at the University of Bath in the UK.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of (Educational) Psychology - Universitas Katolik Atma Jaya Jakarta - 2023

Experience:

Teacher Assistant (Internship) - Little Ants Preschool - 2022

English Tutor - Children English Club - 2021-2023

Occupational Therapist Assistant (Internship) - Precious Kidz - 2017

Vanessa Caitlin was born in Bandung, Indonesia, and recently graduated from Atma Jaya Catholic University of Indonesia majoring in (Educational) Psychology. Before completing her degree, she obtained experience in tutoring children aged 4-12 years old, being an assistant therapist for children with special needs, and being a teacher assistant at a preschool.

She is passionate about early childhood education and enjoys helping young children reach their full potential. Her belief regarding the essential role of education in a child’s development motivates her to dedicate her time and energy to attending to the specific needs of every child. She is beyond excited to meet every student at NJIS!

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Education - State University of Jakarta – 2009

Experience:

Art and Design Teacher - ACS Jakarta, Indonesian (2015-2022)

MYP Visual Art Teacher - Tzu Chi School PIK, Indonesia (2022-2024)

What is not art in this life?

Annis believes the arts are an integral part of everyday life. Graduated from the State University of Jakarta completing her bachelor’s degree in the Fine Arts-Education Program. Experienced teaching visual arts for nine years in various levels, childhood, primary years, middle years and now proceeding Diploma Program.

Engaging classroom environment to optimize student centered application, allowing students to dive in their imagination and foster self expression with helpful guidance in various artistic disciplines such; art methods and techniques in various materials, tools and art forms.

Outside of teaching, Annis finds balance and peace through yoga, integrating mindfulness both physical and emotional. Arts and yoga form a powerful Duo for enhancing her well being. Engaging in yoga promotes physical health, mindfulness, and stress relief, while artistic expression fosters creativity and emotional release.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Chemistry Education- Ganesha University of Education - 2013

Master of Science Education - Ganesha University of Education - 2018

Experience:

Teacher - Sekolah Lentera Kasih Bali - 2012 – 2021

Assistant for Chemistry - SMK N 3 Singaraja - 2011 – 2012

National Principal for Primary - Sekolah Lentera Kasih Bali - 2019 – 2021

Ida Bagus Alit Manuaba is a certified Chemistry teacher who has joined several training for both Cambride and IB curiculums. He joined NJIS in 2021. He graduated from the Ganesha University of Education in Bali. He has been teaching for eight years in his previous school at SLK Bali. He was the Science Coordinator and handled Science for primary to secondary levels, IGCSE Co-ordinated and Combined Sciences, and AS/A Level Chemistry. In His last two years working in his previous school, he was entrusted to become the Primary school principal. To balance his life, he uses his spare time to listen to music and does photography. He also loves to travel to experience new things, different cultures, and exploring the beauty of mother nature.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of English Education, Islamic University of Bukittinggi- 2017

Experiences:

EFL Tutor - MEA Camp Bukittinggi (2013-2014)

Fine Arts Teacher - JAC School Jakarta (2017-2022)

ESL Tutor - TK Islam Tugasku Jakarta (2022)

Amri was born and raised in West Sumatera, Indonesia. He earned his Bachelor of English Education from Islamic University of Bukittinggi. He has taught students from age 7 to 18 years old. His passion for teaching is to help students to be more self-reliant and eager to develop new skills.

In his free time, Amri draws and writes stories. He is the author of a short story collection, More than Ordinary (2015), Pria Laut Merah (2016), and Nyala Cerita (2022). He hopes his arts and stories can inspire others to keep moving forward and make improvement in life.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s of Indonesian Language and Literature Education, S.Pd., - State University of Surabaya - 2014

Master of Humanities, M.Hum, University of Indonesia, – 2018

Experience:

Bahasa Indonesia Teacher – Mimi School Surabaya - 2014 – 2016

Lecturer, researcher, and Student affairs staff - University of Pancasila, Jakarta- 2018 – 2021

IBDP Bahasa Teacher – Bogor Raya IB World School, Bogor - 2021 – 2023

Allan graduated with a Master's degree in Humanities from the University of Indonesia. His research focused on popular culture, digital narratives, and YouTube. He began his career as a teacher and lecturer in 2015. He frequently attends international conferences in various cities and abroad. For example, in 2018, he participated in KIBSS in Myeongdong, South Korea, where he shared his ideas on the influence of East Asian and Southeast Asian films and their impact on youth in Indonesia. Allan enjoys discussing a wide range of topics, aiming to create an engaging environment for NJIS students who are learning Bahasa Indonesia. Don't hesitate to join in the discussions and engage in friendly conversations with him. As an extrovert who loves to chat and socialize, he ensures that learning Bahasa Indonesia is a fun and enjoyable experience. Let's get started on this exciting language journey!

Qualification:

Bachelor’s of Physical Education- Semarang State University - 2013

Teacher Professional Certification- Padang State University - 2021

Experience:

Physical Education Teacher-Saint Johns School Meruya- 2014-2019

Physical Education Teacher- Saint John Catholic School BSD - 2019-2022

Soccer Coach - Santa Laurensia Alam Sutera 2018-2020

Alamsyah was born in Semarang and graduated with his Bachelor's degree from Semarang State University of Education in 2013. He has been teaching Physical Education Since 2014. As a Physical Education teacher, He really likes to do physical and sport activity. Mr. Alam is passionate about physical and sports activities. He want to share the values of sports while he was a sports activist as a teacher and coach. Being a Physical Education teacher is a way to share the value of sport with others that can be adapted to daily life.

She is currently in her ninth year as a teacher and considers it to be the greatest adventure of her life. She believes that being a huge part of the formation of students, she has a responsibility to ensure that certain values and principles are inculcated in their young minds. It has been a personal advocacy of hers to open their minds to the social realities outside of their comfort zones. She wants them to see the value of empathy and a sense of civic responsibility even in their young lives.

Iqbal was born in a remote most village of Punjab, Pakistan. As a student, he spent most of his time in boarding schools and hostels and immediately after completing his education he got his first job as a science teacher in Maldives. Till that time he has been living abroad moving into different countries and consider himself an international educator. He is married, father of two sons and a lovely daughter.

This is his 21st year in International teaching and seventh international school. During the last twenty one years, he has gone through a huge shift from being a briefcase teacher to a person who strongly believes in sharing and connectivism. Even though he is still at the bottom level of connectivism and a big lurker but also having an appearance online. The credit for this mind shift does go to COETAIL, Certificate of Educational Technology and Information Literacy. He loves to play tennis but his cricket skills are always a hurdle to being very good at tennis. Swimming, hiking and badminton are also his favorites.

“Dr. Thombi earned undergraduate and graduate engineering degrees in the US and Japan. He has a wide range of experience in working as a researcher and an engineer in government and private sectors. Over the years, he has developed deep passion in educating the youth and has been involved in education by teaching various engineering-related subjects at local schools and universities.

He wants to see more Indonesians youths, especially girls, to develop more interests in science and technology. In his spare time he enjoys playing and listening to music, watching good movies and reading good books.”

Goentoer is a highly experienced high school university counselor with years of experience. He is passionate about helping students achieve their university goals and has a strong understanding of the university admissions process, both overseas and locally. He excels in building positive relationships with students, parents, and teachers, and is committed to providing the necessary support for students to succeed in their university search and admission journey. Goentoer is an active member of NISC, the Network of Indonesian School Counselors, which serves as a support network for university counselors in Indonesia.

Aside from his professional pursuits, Goentoer is a coffee enthusiast, particularly enjoying black coffee and flat white as his two favorite coffee choices, without any added sugar. In his spare time, he indulges in watching movies and exploring the art of manual coffee brewing.

Amalia has been a music teacher in intercultural schools since 2015. Aside from teaching in the K-12 school systems, she also shared her knowledge of guitar playing technique, performing arts, and music technology with many universities and music colleges in Indonesia. RSL Awards UK awarded her the “Rockstar Award” for her teaching achievement in Jakarta, and the “Music School Network Award” when she was spreading her work in Bali.

Amalia loves encouraging her students to pursue their goals, believe in themselves, and spread kindness to the community, animals, and environment. For her, students are the best teachers. She believes that teaching can change lives for the better!

Ms. Nevi was born and raised in a small yet lovely town, Tembagapura (known as The Land Above The Clouds) in Papua. She started her career as a pharmacist and worked in healthcare industries for over 6 years. In 2016, she decided to start an adventure in Australia. She worked in various companies there, majority in hospitality industries. She experienced journeys which made her turned her career to early years education industry. Then, in 2018 she enrolled in Diploma Program of Early Childhood & Education Care. She believes that the first 5 years of children's life is the golden moment for them to develop their cognitive, physical, social, emotional, and language skills. For her, being an educator is a long life learning so she will never stop to learn. Ms. Nevi also serves in Sunday School, teaches Grade 1-3 students. She is very grateful to be able to become part of students learning journey.
